t: Job 19
Then*p Job answered and said,
How*p long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?
These*p ten times have ye reproached me: ye are not ashamed that ye make yourselves strange to me.
And*p be it indeed that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.
If*p indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach:
Know*p now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.
Behold,*p I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.
He*p hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
He*p hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.
He*p hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.
He*p hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.
His*p troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.
He*p hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.
My*p kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.
They*p that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.
I*p called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I entreated him with my mouth.
My*p breath is strange to my wife, though I entreated for the children's sake of mine own body.
Yea,*p young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me.
All*p my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me.
My*p bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.
Have*p pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.
Why*p do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?
Oh*p that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book!
That*p they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!
For*p I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth:
And*p though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God:
Whom*p I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another; though my reins be consumed within me.
But*p ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?
Be*p ye afraid of the sword: for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.
